FEEDBACK_TEXT: Very frustrating experience this morning trying to submit my expense report. Took almost 5 hours from first attempt to finally getting it through. I understand systems have issues but there should be better communication when something is wrong. I wasted a lot of time before finding out there was a workaround. Month-end deadlines are stressful enough without this.

Unacceptable experience with the expense system today. As an SVP I should not have to spend my morning fighting with technology. I had to escalate through multiple levels before anyone could fix my issue. The workaround should have been communicated proactively. I expect better from our IT organization.

Had an issue with expense reports this morning but IT support was really helpful. They explained about the auto-save feature which I didn't know about - that saved me a lot of rework. The workaround they provided worked on the first try. Good support experience despite the system issues.

Great tip from IT about setting up backup MFA options! I never knew I could use offline codes. Now I won't get locked out if my phone is on silent again. The support agent was patient and thorough. Would be great if this was part of new hire onboarding.

Teams crashed during my presentation which was embarrassing but IT helped me understand it's a hardware limitation. I submitted a laptop refresh request but concerned about how long it will take. Would be nice if there was proactive monitoring to identify laptops that need upgrades before they cause issues.
TOPICS_EXTRACTED: teams crash hardware proactive monitoring suggestion

FEEDBACK_TEXT: VPN issue this morning was resolved relatively quickly once I got to IT. The agent knew exactly what was wrong and walked me through the fix. Would have been even better if there was a status page alert so I knew it wasn't just me.

Didn't know about the OneDrive sync trick for large files - game changer! The support agent taught me something new that will save time going forward. This should be more widely communicated. Maybe a tips newsletter or something?

IT helped me understand Power Pivot and now my giant spreadsheet actually works. They even sent me training resources. This is the kind of proactive help that makes a difference. Really appreciated the time they took to teach me rather than just fixing my immediate problem.

Had to use my personal phone for a client call because corporate Zoom was blocked. This is a security concern - we shouldn't have to use personal devices for work. Glad it was fixed but this never should have happened.
TOPICS_EXTRACTED: zoom security personal device compliance concern

FEEDBACK_TEXT: Dashboard refresh issue was resolved and I learned that it's now scheduled at a better time. Appreciated the explanation of why it happened rather than just 'it's fixed now'. Understanding helps me set expectations with my team.

Completely blocked from work for over 4 hours due to certificate issue. This cost me an entire morning of productivity during a busy period. The emergency certificate process seems too slow for critical issues like this. When remote workers can't connect that should be treated as a P1 from the start.
TOPICS_EXTRACTED: vpn certificate outage productivity p1 priority

FEEDBACK_TEXT: Outlook was crashing constantly but IT fixed it and helped me archive old emails. My mailbox was way too big apparently. Good learning experience - now I have an auto-archive set up. Wish I'd known about the 25GB recommendation earlier.

IT helped me set up a password manager after I got locked out from vacation. This should be offered to everyone! So much better than trying to remember all my passwords. The setup was easy and the agent was really patient.

Overall IT systems are okay but I feel like we hear about issues after they're already affecting us. Would love to see more proactive communication - maybe a status dashboard we can check, or alerts for known issues. Sometimes I spend 30 minutes troubleshooting before finding out it's a known problem.
Had audio issues during a call but IT helped me troubleshoot. Turns out it was a Bluetooth issue. They suggested using wired headphones for important calls which makes sense. Good quick support.
Normal expense submission worked fine for me today. No issues to report. The system seems faster than it used to be. Nice improvement.

iPhone receipt photos work now after changing my camera settings but this feels like a workaround rather than a fix. Hope the permanent solution comes soon. Shouldn't have to change my phone settings for work apps.
Love the new IT knowledge base! Found a solution to my SharePoint issue without even opening a ticket. More self-service like this please. Saved me a lot of time.

Overall IT support has been good lately. Response times seem faster than they were last year. I appreciate that agents actually explain what went wrong rather than just clicking around. Makes me feel more confident using the systems.

Expense issue this morning was annoying but glad there was a workaround. Would have been nice to know about it before I wasted an hour trying. Maybe push notifications for known issues affecting common workflows?
Salesforce has been running smoothly for me. Reports load faster than before. Whatever optimizations were done - thank you!
VPN has been stable for me lately. Working from home is much smoother than it was a year ago. Appreciate the infrastructure improvements.
Teams meetings are still choppy on my laptop especially with video on. I've reported this multiple times. When will the hardware refreshes actually happen? Been waiting for 3 months now.
TOPICS_EXTRACTED: teams performance hardware refresh delay frustration

FEEDBACK_TEXT: SharePoint is okay but navigation is confusing. Too many sites and I can never find what I'm looking for. Search doesn't always work well. Maybe some organization or training would help?
SSO is seamless now. I can switch between apps without constantly re-authenticating. This is how it should have always worked. Great improvement!
ServiceNow portal is much better than the old system. Finding the right category is easier and I can track my tickets. Good redesign.

Typical experience - some things work great others need improvement. Main pain point is still the expense report process which seems overly complicated. Why do we need both Workday and Concur? Consolidation would be nice.
Teams integration with Outlook calendar works really well. Meeting links auto-populate and I can join with one click. Small thing but saves time every day.

Just want to say the IT support team has been excellent. Every ticket I've opened has been resolved professionally and quickly. Special shoutout to the agent who helped me with my laptop issue last week - they went above and beyond.

Regarding today's expense issue - I understand things break but the communication was really lacking. I found out about the workaround from a colleague on Slack, not from IT. By the time the official communication went out I'd already wasted 2 hours. Please consider faster alerting for widespread issues.
